Amanda's Mom: I hate it with a passion and I wasn't even there.
Amanda: The Trenchbul would have loved tonight.
Sing it with me, kids: caricature is not satire~
There was a talk back after. Naturally I asked why the liberal characters were so ridiculous, I got a lecture about satire.
Ok so I was hoping the 2nd half would be better but I am disappointed. The acting was definitely better but not the content.
But come on now.
But everything I know says that is the opposite. I know I get riled when it comes to evolution. I know this.
Example: schools won't let you teach about God because you have to teach evolution. Idk where this playwright is, or about their experiences
They are the unreal examples people like to trot out to prove a point.
However. The themes they are highlighting, while there are some truths to them, are lacking depth. They are caricatures and exaggerations.
I also like the self-drags the playwrights have put in. Poking fun at themselves and the stereotypes generally associated with conservatives
Now, as for the plays so far. There are some good points: just because someone has different views doesn't mean they are horrible. Truth.
So I'm at the Conservative Theatre Festival. First, I'd like to say the nervousness is adorable. That is not sarcasm.
"Hey look, I drank nearly a bottle of this and lived."
